00063 #include "egs_base_geometry.h"

00065 #include<vector>
00066 using std::vector;
00067 
00097 class EGS_UNIONG_EXPORT EGS_UnionGeometry : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00098 
00099 public:
00100 
00104       EGS_UnionGeometry(const vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> &geoms,
00105               const int *priorities = 0, const string &Name = "");
00106 
00107       ~EGS_UnionGeometry();
00108 
00109       bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00110           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return false;
00111           int j = ireg/nmax; return g[j]->isRealRegion(ireg-j*nmax);
00112       };
00113 
00114       bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00115           for(int j=0; j<ng; j++) if( g[j]->isInside(x) ) return true;
00116           return false;
00117       };
00118 
00119       int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00120           for(int j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00121               int ij = g[j]->isWhere(x);
00122               if( ij >= 0 ) return ij + j*nmax;
00123           }
00124           return -1;
00125       };
00126 
00127       int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) { return isWhere(x); };
00128 
00129       int medium(int ireg) const {
00130           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return -1;
00131           int j = ireg/nmax;
00132           return g[j]->medium(ireg-j*nmax);
00133       };
00134 
00135       int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00136                  EGS_Float &t,int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00137           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00138               // we are inside, set current geometry
00139               int jg = ireg/nmax;
00140               // distance to boundary and new region in this geometry.
00141               int inew = g[jg]->howfar(ireg-jg*nmax,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00142               // jgnew is the geometry after the step
00143               int jgnew = inew >= 0 ? jg : -1;
00144               // geometries are now ordered in decreasing priorities.
00145               // Then,
00146               //   - if the particle remains in the current geometry,
00147               //     we only need to check geometries up to jg-1
00148               //     For these geometries the particle must be outside,
00149               //     otherwise it would have been in one of them
00150               //   - if the particle exits the current geometry, then
00151               //     we must also check jg+1...ng-1
00152               for(int j=0; j<jg; j++) {
00153                   int ii = g[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00154                   if( ii >= 0 ) {
00155                       jgnew = j; inew = ii;
00156                   }
00157               }
00158               if( inew < 0 ) {
00159                   // the particle didn't enter any of the higher priority
00160                   // geometries but exits the current one.
00161                   // => we need to check if the particle is in one
00162                   // of the lower priority geometries at the exit point.
00163                   EGS_Vector xnew(x+u*t);
00164                   for(int j=jg+1; j<ng; j++) {
00165                       int ii = g[j]->isWhere(xnew);
00166                       if( ii >= 0 ) {
00167                           // when exiting jg, particle is in region ii of geometry j
00168                           // we don't need to check other geometries because they
00169                           // have a lower priority.
00170                           jgnew = j; inew = ii; break;
00171                       }
00172                   }
00173               }
00174               if( inew < 0 ) return inew;
00175               if( newmed ) *newmed = g[jgnew]->medium(inew);
00176               return inew + jgnew*nmax;
00177           }
00178           // if here, we are currently outside of all geometries in the union.
00179           int jg, inew=-1;
00180           for(int j=0; j<ng; j++) {
00181               int ii = g[j]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00182               if( ii >= 0 ) { jg = j; inew = ii;}
00183           }
00184           return inew < 0 ? -1 : inew + jg*nmax;
00185       };
00186 
00187       EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00188           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00189               int jg = ireg/nmax;
00190               EGS_Float tmin = g[jg]->hownear(ireg-jg*nmax,x);
00191               if( tmin <= 0 ) return 0;
00192               // tmin is now the perpendicular distance to a boundary
00193               // in the current geometry.
00194               // we need to check all geometries with higher priorities
00195               // i.e., all geometries between 0 and jg-1.
00196               // as their priorities are higher, we know that we are
00197               // outside of such geometries.
00198               for(int j=jg-1; j>=0; --j) {
00199                   EGS_Float t = g[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00200                   if( t < tmin ) {
00201                       tmin = t; if( tmin <= 0 ) return 0;
00202                   }
00203               }
00204               return tmin;
00205           }
00206           // if here, we are outside of all geomtries in the union.
00207           EGS_Float tmin = 1e30;
00208           for(int j=ng-1; j>=0; j--) {
00209               EGS_Float t = g[j]->hownear(-1,x);
00210               if( t < tmin ) tmin = t;
00211               if( tmin <= 0 ) return 0;
00212           }
00213           return tmin;
00214       };
00215 
00216       int getMaxStep() const {
00217           int nstep = 1;
00218           for(int j=0; j<ng; ++j) nstep += g[j]->getMaxStep();
00219           return nstep;
00220       };
00221 
00222       const string &getType() const { return type; };
00223 
00224       void printInfo() const;
00225 
00226       EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00227           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return 1;
00228           int jg = ireg/nmax;
00229           return g[jg]->getRelativeRho(ireg-jg*nmax);
00230       };
00231       void setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00232       void setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00233 
00234       virtual void getLabelRegions (const string &str, vector<int> &regs);
00235 
00236 protected:
00237 
00238       EGS_BaseGeometry **g;     
00239       int              ng;      
00240       int              nmax;    
00241       static string    type;    
00242 
00249       void setMedia(EGS_Input *,int,const int *);
00250 
00251 };
00252 
00253 #endif
